sections.title: Identity Verification
sections.content: Verify age without collecting personal data.

sections.title: 1. THE "ANTI-COLLECTION" PLEDGE
sections.content: Unlike traditional identity providers, Powm is designed to know nothing about you. We have architected our system so that we technically cannot access your personal data, even if we wanted to.

sections.title: 2. WHAT WE DO NOT COLLECT
sections.content:
To be absolutely clear, when you use the Powm App or verify your age:

NO Personal Identity Information (PII): We do not collect your name, date of birth, address, phone number, or government ID scans.

NO IP Addresses: We do not log or store your IP address.

NO Browser Fingerprints: We do not collect data about your browser, screen size, or battery level to track you.

NO Usage History: We do not know which websites you visit. We only process a cryptographic "Yes/No" signal.

sections.title: 3. WHAT WE DO STORE (AND WHY)
sections.content:
We store only one piece of data to make the service function:

Device Identifier (Security Key):

What it is: A unique, random cryptographic ID generated on your mobile device.

Why we need it: This allows your specific phone to "sign" a proof of age without revealing who you are. It ensures that a proof cannot be faked or replayed by hackers.

Can it identify you? No. It is not linked to your email, phone number, or Apple/Google account. It is just a random string of numbers linked to this specific installation of the app.

sections.title: 4. LOCAL-FIRST STORAGE
sections.content:
Your Identity Wallet (including your age attestation) is stored locally on your device.

It is encrypted in your phone’s Secure Enclave.

Powm’s servers do not hold the decryption keys.

If you delete the app without a backup, your data is gone forever. We cannot restore it because we never had it.

sections.title: 5. DATA RETENTION
sections.content:
Verification Logs: When you prove your age, we generate a temporary technical log (Success/Fail timestamp). This log contains no destination URL and no user identity.

Deletion: These technical logs are automatically purged every 30 days.

sections.title: 1. ACCEPTANCE OF TERMS
sections.content: By downloading or using Powm ("The Service"), you agree to these terms. If you do not agree, delete the app immediately.

sections.title: 2. THE SERVICE
sections.content:
Powm is a technical tool that allows you to hold and present digital proofs (e.g., "Over 18").

No Warranty: We provide the service "as is." We do not guarantee that every merchant or website will accept Powm proofs.

Not a Government ID: Powm is not a replacement for your physical passport or driver’s license in legal or government settings.

sections.title: 3. USER RESPONSIBILITY (YOUR DEVICE, YOUR LIABILITY)
sections.content:
Because Powm is a Local-First wallet, you are the sole custodian of your data.

Security: You are responsible for securing your phone (PIN, Biometrics). If someone steals your unlocked phone and uses it to verify age, Powm is not liable.

Loss of Data: If you lose your device or delete the app, your credentials are lost. Powm cannot recover them for you.

sections.title: 4. PROHIBITED USE
sections.content:
You agree not to use Powm for:

Verifying age to access illegal content (e.g., CSAM, terrorism).

Attempting to reverse-engineer the cryptographic protocols.

Using a rooted/jailbroken device to spoof verifications.

Result: We reserve the right to ban your Device Identifier if we detect cryptographic tampering or bot-like activity.

sections.title: 5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
sections.content:
To the maximum extent permitted by law, Powm shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from your use of the service.

We are not responsible for the content, privacy practices, or safety of the Third-Party Websites you access using Powm. We only open the door; we do not control what is inside.

sections.title: 6. GOVERNING LAW
sections.content: These terms are governed by the laws of France. Any disputes shall be resolved in the courts of Paris.

whitepaper.title: Identity without surveillance
whitepaper.subtitle: The Powm Standard for a Privacy-First Web

sections.title: 1. Introduction
sections.content: The internet was built on a promise of freedom, but anonymity has created dangerous blind spots. To protect minors and enforce accountability, regulators (ARCOM, AVMSD) now demand strict verification, pushing the industry toward a "Total Surveillance" model where digital checkpoints require sensitive document uploads at every URL. Powm proposes a third path. We are a next-generation digital identity wallet that solves the two biggest problems in the digital economy: User Friction and Data Liability. We refuse to accept the "False Choice" between safety and privacy. By allowing users to store their own identity credentials locally and share them via cryptographic proofs, Powm enables businesses to verify users instantly without ever handling, seeing, or storing sensitive personal documents.

sections.title: 2. The Market Problem: A Broken Trust Model
sections.content: Today’s identity landscape fails both the user and the enterprise.

sections.title: 2.1 The "Honeypot" & Liability Risk
sections.content: Current solutions rely on centralized databases. To verify age or identity, businesses must collect passports and selfies, creating massive "honeypots" of data. For Business: This creates toxic liability (GDPR/CCPA compliance burdens) and turns their servers into targets for hackers. For Users: It creates a "Surveillance Economy." Verification events become data points, tracking user behavior across the web.

sections.title: 2.2 The Friction Crisis
sections.content: Security kills conversion. Users detest long signup forms and intrusive facial scans. Drop-off: When faced with a requirement to upload an ID for a simple transaction, users churn. Redundancy: Users are forced to repeat this invasive process for every single service they use.

sections.title: 3. The Powm Solution: Proof Without Exposure
sections.content: Powm flips the model. We replace "Data Transfer" with "Cryptographic Proof." Instead of a central database holding IDs, every user carries their own verified credentials in a secure wallet on their device.

sections.title: 3.1 The Local-First Vault
sections.content: We believe identity belongs to the individual. In the Powm architecture, identity attributes (e.g., "Over 18," "Verified Resident") are stored locally on the user’s device hardware (Secure Enclave). The Difference: Instead of the cloud holding the ID, the phone holds a cryptographic "permit." The Benefit: A hacker cannot steal what the business does not hold.

sections.title: 3.2 Double-Blind Architecture
sections.content: Powm mathematically decouples Who You Are from What You Do. The Issuer checks the ID but never sees which websites the user visits. The Verifier (Business) receives a guaranteed "YES/NO" token but never sees the user’s IP address or raw data. The Result: Compliance is achieved, but the digital trail is broken.

sections.title: 4. How It Works: The "Scan & Go" Flow
sections.content:
We have reduced complex cryptography to a seamless consumer experience.

Challenge: The Application (e.g., an age-restricted site or event venue) requests a specific verification: "Verify user is 18+."

Interaction: The user scans a QR code with their Powm Wallet.

Decision: The user sees exactly what is requested and taps "Accept."

Proof: Powm generates a single-use cryptographic token. The Application receives instant verification.

The Result: No forms. No typing. No uploads. Just a "Green Light" in seconds.

sections.title: 5.1 Value Proposition
sections.content: Zero Friction: Instant verification increases conversion rates compared to traditional ID uploads. Zero Liability: Businesses never touch raw PII (Personally Identifiable Information). You cannot lose data you never collected. Cost Efficiency: Our model is significantly cheaper than current market solutions (e.g., legacy KYC providers).

sections.title: 5.2 Pricing Model: Pay-Per-Challenge
sections.content:
We operate on a utility model.

Performance-based: You are only charged when a user successfully completes an identity challenge.

Risk-free: Unsuccessful, canceled, or rejected challenges incur no cost.

sections.title: 5.3 Core Use Cases
sections.content:
Age-Restricted Content: Compliance with ARCOM/AVMSD without ruining the user experience or storing user logs.

E-Commerce & Retail: Instant checkout verification for high-risk goods.

Physical Access & Events: Combining ticketing with identity in a single, unforgeable scan.

sections.title: 6. Conclusion: A Neutral Utility
sections.content: As the demand for digital identity grows, society rejects the "Surveillance State" model. Powm positions itself as a Neutral External Utility: we have no ad network, no political agenda, and no data monetization. We are building the infrastructure where Privacy and Safety are partners. By leveraging modern cryptography, we allow businesses to enforce the laws of the physical world while preserving the freedom of the digital world. Powm: Prove the Age. Not the Identity.
